meanings.sent1: If you touch a dirty surface and then touch your face, you may accidentally reinfect yourself with germs.
meanings.sent2: After recovering from the flu, be careful not to reinfect yourself by being around sick people.
meanings.sent3: Tom thought he had finally beaten the video game boss, only to accidentally reinfect his saved game and start over.
meanings.sent4: The weeds in the garden seemed to reinfect the flower bed every time they were pulled out.
meanings.sent5: The computer virus was so sneaky that it could reinfect the system even after it was supposedly removed.

meanings.definition: To cause a person or animal to become infected with a disease again.
meanings.sent1: If you don't wash your hands, you might reinfect others with the cold virus.
meanings.sent2: The doctor warned the patient to stay isolated to avoid reinfecting the community with the contagious illness.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to reinfect the entire household with fleas after the flea treatment wore off.
meanings.sent4: The contaminated water source continued to reinfect the village with the same illness despite efforts to purify it.
meanings.sent5: The lack of proper hygiene practices can easily reinfect a population with preventable diseases.
